content.description: Hand crack going up a corner, with a bit of off width at the top. Has a series of gentle grade, then steep grade, gentle grade steep grade. The start requires going up some choss and dried mud for about 10 feet, then solid rock after that. The climbing is pretty straight forward and easy, the protection, not so much. Being creative with the gear is a must.
content.protection: I used 1 #5, 1 #2, and 1 #4. There are 3 glue in bolts a few feet to the right on top.
content.location: Second alcove from the east end of the formation. About 100 feet to the left of Hearing Voices. Opposite of Live Trap chimney.

content.description: A big, wide, cool looking chimney with an overhang to pull over about halfway up. Unfortunately, the rock condition goes to crap after the pulling through the roof. The tight hand crack on the right side of the upper section feels solid deep in it, sink those cams! But the rest of the rock tends to crumble under you feet. Definitely not for those scared of falling.
content.protection: Crack under the roof has a good spot for a #.5 and #3, the crack going up the upper section take #.75 or #1, whichever you prefer. There are some chock stones that could possibly be slung, they didn't seem the most solid rock however. 3 glue in bolts on top.
content.location: Big chimney on the opposite side of the rock from Mandible

content.description:
Starts on splitter finger crack that zig zags up through horizontal cracks to a big ledge. All the cracks give it a blocky, insecure look, but it feels really solid. Right underneath the ledge, rock quality diminishes severely, if you go to far right, it turns into dry mud, just go straight up through the few feet of secure choss and gain the ledge. From the ledge up is a beautiful, slightly overhanging hand crack.

The first section can be bypassed by climbing the beginning of 465 Easy St. up to the Fork in the Road ledge, then traversing over to the crack. Doing this would knock the rating down to 5.9, maybe 5.9+.
content.protection: Used a Blue Totem Basic and a Green Totem Basic on the bottom section, then 2 #1, and #4. There is a good #3 placement above where I placed the #4, I elected to use that spot for hand jams instead of protection. 3 glue in bolts on top.
content.location: This route is in the first alcove on the east end of the formation. It is the obvious crack splitting the middle of the wall.

content.description: This is the more vertical, wide crack the splits off to the right about 3/4 of the way up 465 Easy St.
content.protection: 1 #4, 1 #6, 1 #5, 3 glue in bolts on top to the right
content.location: Different top out to 465 Easy St.

content.description: Big off width crack in a corner with a funky start. The start is behind a small flake, stem up between the flake and the corner, and mantle up onto a ledge. This is the fork in the road ledge. From here, there are two off widths, this route is the OW on climbers left. Nice mellow grade, becoming more mellow the higher up you go. Great knee jams and arm bar/chicken wings all the way up.
content.protection: Used 1 #4, 1 #6, and 1 #5, all C4 sizes. A belay anchor can be built with big gear on the top, or there are 3 glue in bolts about 6 feet to the climbers right.
content.location: This route is in the first alcove from the east end of the formation. The start is in the corner, about 10 feet to climbers left of the obvious crack, Hearing Voices.
